context_analysis.email_summary: No new emails requiring attention or action items
context_analysis.energy_patterns: Energy level 7/10 indicates good capacity for focused work. Peak performance likely in morning hours with gradual decline through afternoon
strategic_priorities: Existing plan loaded suggests continuity with previous planning
No specific tasks indicates flexibility for strategic work
time_constraints: No fixed commitments allows for optimal energy-based scheduling

reasoning.scheduling_strategy: Leverage high morning energy for deep work on echo project. Structure day with 90-minute focus blocks followed by strategic breaks. Front-load cognitively demanding tasks while energy is highest. Build in flexibility for personal tasks in afternoon when energy naturally dips
reasoning.energy_optimization: Start with highest-impact work during 6-9am window when cognitive function peaks. Schedule creative/strategic work in mid-morning. Reserve routine tasks for post-lunch period. Include two major recovery breaks to maintain energy level throughout extended workday
reasoning.priority_sequencing: Echo project gets prime morning slots as primary work focus. Personal tasks distributed throughout day for variety and mental refreshment. Administrative work scheduled for lower-energy afternoon periods
reasoning.recovery_planning: Strategic 30-minute breaks after intense work blocks. Lunch break positioned to divide day and provide substantial recovery. Evening wind-down period to transition from work mode. Short transitions between different types of tasks to prevent fatigue

narrative.summary: I've crafted your schedule around your solid energy level of 7, front-loading your most important echo project work in the morning when you'll be sharpest. Since you have no fixed commitments today, I've created a rhythm of focused 90-minute work blocks followed by strategic breaks to maintain your energy throughout the 16-hour day. I've also woven in personal tasks during natural energy dips in the afternoon, giving you mental variety while still making progress on both projects.

questions.question: Would you prefer longer, uninterrupted work blocks on echo, or is the 90-minute rhythm good for maintaining focus?
questions.context: This affects how we structure your deep work periods

questions.question: Are there any specific echo project milestones you're targeting this week?
questions.context: This would help me prioritize which aspects of the project to tackle during peak hours

key_insights: Front-loaded echo project work capitalizes on peak morning energy
90-minute work blocks align with natural focus cycles
Strategic breaks prevent energy depletion across 16-hour day
Personal tasks provide mental variety and prevent burnout
Flexible afternoon schedule adapts to natural energy fluctuations
